For CMS the quickstart package is called quickstart and this one gettingstarted, while `hst' is not part of the package name. I think all quickstart packages should have `quickstart' in their name and they also all should contain the project (product) name in their name. Or maybe there is some other consistent and clear naming scheme.

li.a: binaries: Serving binaries with the BinariesServlet

ul.li: property of your current item. In the following example
is a subnode of the current pageNode:
An HST2 web filter provides an object in request scope that is able to access the current pageNode. This object, by default identified by the name

The URLMappingTemplateContextFilter will examine the current request and will try to resolve the current pageNode. The pageNode contains all information on the current request and will gather all information about it's sub elements on the current page:
Exposes the current pageNode (selected document) to the JSP file.
Creates a rewritten link for the current document, based on the urlmapping.
allows you to provide additional parameters to the current module.
The required string location relative to the current context from which a new context is created.
allows you to provide additional parameters to the current module.
instanties the current module and based on the attributes renders or executes the modules businesslogic.
exposes the current pageNode to the current JSP pageContext. Within the JSP you can use the pageNode to retrieve the content of the selected document.
